import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import calendar

import os

    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.9cb593a0:
plt.figure(figsize=(8,8))
sns.distplot(data['total_gross'],color='#f9c74f')
plt.title('TOTAL GROSS - DISTRIBUTION(USD)',fontsize=18,color='#f9c74f',fontweight='bold')
plt.xlabel('Total Gross',fontsize=10)
plt.ylabel('Frequency',fontsize=10)
plt.show()
source.5f5c4a60:
plt.figure(figsize=(8,8))
sns.distplot(data['inflation_adjusted_gross'],color='#457b9d')
plt.title('ADJUSTED GROSS - DISTRIBUTION(USD)',fontsize=18,color='#457b9d',fontweight='bold')
plt.xlabel('Inflation Adjusted Gross',fontsize=10)
plt.ylabel('Frequency',fontsize=10)
plt.show()
source.4a6697d2:
plt.figure(figsize=(15,12))
sns.boxplot(data['inflation_adjusted_gross'],data['genre'],palette=sns.color_palette('viridis'))
plt.title('GENRE & GROSS REVENUE',fontsize=18,fontweight='bold',color='#1d3557')
plt.ylabel('Genre',fontsize=10)
plt.xlabel('Revenue(Inflation Adjusted)',fontsize=10)
plt.show()
source.5fd81c1f:
plt.figure(figsize=(15,8))
sns.heatmap(month_trend,annot=True,linewidths=2,cmap='cool')
plt.title("TREND OF GENRE'S BY RELEASE MONTH",fontsize=18,fontweight='bold',color='#1d3557')
plt.ylabel('Release Month',fontsize=10)
plt.xlabel('Genre',fontsize=10)

plt.show()
source.5d26e060: Columns genre and mpaa rating have null values but they are less than 10 % and will not have much impact.
source.0808345a: There are 5 movie's which have multiple entries. We need to be careful while summarizing.
source.0e8e38dc: After gross revenue is adjusted to inflation, we see that the revenue distribution ranges from 0 to 5 billion. A majority of movies are below 1 billion USD. Lets check the top 5 movies with highest box office gross.
source.b5b2fba7:
A movie could have be categorized into multiple genres.But in this dataset, we have one genre tagged to every movie. The below interpretation might change, if the data changes.
* Disney has released more movies in Comedy genre.Yet the median revenue from the genre is less and has few outliers.
* There are extreme outliers for musical category though they are less compared to other genres.
* The median revenue for Musical and Adventure genre are closer. Similarly for Drama,Comedy and Action which are heavily dominated by outliers.
source.fa9b1723: A majority of the movies fall under 200 Million gross whereas there are also movies which have grossed close to a billion. Lets check the adjusted gross which considers inflation index and would be a much appropriate way to quantify the revenue.
source.2c81f618: Lets check the distribution of revenue by genre,
source.a1ce072e: We are going to explore 579 movies of Disney released between 1937 -2016 .
